result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leshon M Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed and Filed, Order. Restitution previously ordered of $1,020.00 to Interstate Parking is to be paid through the term of probation on 16CF5368, if revoked, to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate. Balance to be paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case previously dismissed but read in. Received and filed, Restitution Worksheet and Crime VIctim Impact Statement with attachments. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,020.00 to Interstate Parking. Restitution to be paid during period of probation on 16CF5368. If revoked on that case, restitution to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, remainder to be paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. Pursuant to plea agreement, on motion of the State, Court ordered case Dismissed, But Read In.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Branch 18 has deliberating jury and may be in another trial. Parties request an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 18.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Case set for Plea and Sentencing with felony matter in Branch 18 on 5/3/2017 at 1:30 pm.
Case accepted by Branch 18. File sent over to Branch 18.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Neither party wishes to address the court on the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Case in court for pre-trial conference.  Defendant has a pending felony in Branch 18 Judge Colon.  Per parties request, Judge Dugan does not object for this case to be transfer to Branch 18 for global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Leshon M Boyd in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Leshon M Boyd
Current: 5873 N 51st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 12-02-2016)
Prior: 3948 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Leshon M Boyd not in court.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an arest  warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 
*** Court makes findings that there is a possible victim identified therefore recompense is an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/24/15 @ 1:30 pm
